DataElement.preferredName: Clinical T4b Fixation Invasion Area Anatomic Site Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free text field to specify the location within the body where a primary tumor moves one cell type into an area normally occupied by a different cell type.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The direct observation of the location within the body where a primary tumor moves one cell type into an area normally occupied by a different cell type.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation. The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:A general term that refers to a TNM finding of a primary tumor with direct invasion of adjacent structures. The definition of T4b TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for bladder cancer it refers to a primary tumor that invades the pelvic wall and abdominal wall; for gastric cancer it refers to a primary tumor that invades adjacent structures; for colorectal cancer it refers to a primary tumor with direct invasion or adherence to other organs or structures.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

A general term that refers to a TNM finding of a primary tumor with direct invasion of adjacent structures. The definition of T4b TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for bladder cancer it refers to a primary tumor that invades the pelvic wall and abdominal wall; for gastric cancer it refers to a primary tumor that invades adjacent structures; for colorectal cancer it refers to a primary tumor with direct invasion or adherence to other organs or structures.

Property.preferredDefinition: The preservation and hardening of a tissue sample to retain as nearly as possible the same relations they had in the living body.:The movement of one cell type into an area normally occupied by a different cell type.:Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: The chemical preservation of a substance to maintain structural and/or molecular features of that substance as they exist in the living entity.
The movement of one cell type into an area normally occupied by a different cell type.
Named locations of or within the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify an anatomic site.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Specify clinical T4b area of fixation and/or invasion
